result.execSummary:
The defendant ROBERT C RICE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -Court will allow early termination of probation if the agent recommends it.

miscConds.notes: -To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the first year of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

timeConds.notes: -Sentence is to commence within 60 days.  Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. ROBERT C RICE

records.addlTxt:
2:42 PM Defendant ROBERT C RICE in court.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for ROBERT C RICE.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court recites agreement - will plea to count 1 with probation and conditions and count 2 will be dismissed and read-in and defense is free to argue. ADA concurs. Atty Kapelis concurs. Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Sentencing statement by ADA. Sentencing statement by Atty Kapelis. No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.

CONDITIONS:

-30 days county jail. Sentence is to commence within 60 days.  Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel. 
-Court costs. To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the first year of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency. 
-AODA and any follow-up.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.  
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Court will allow early termination of probation if the agent recommends it.

Court adjourned at 2:52 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 20, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

8:32 AM Defendant ROBERT C RICE in court.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for ROBERT C RICE.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis states the defendant will waive the preliminary hearing. Defendant concurs. Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court, same as the criminal complaint and copy emailed to Atty Kapelis. Attorney Kapelis acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Kapelis enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. 

Court adjourned at 8:35 AM

Court will set for Return Date on July 18, 2022 at 10:30 AM.
Return date scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Return date on July 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant's dad called to inform us that they were not able to download the zoom thru there x-box as it kept asking for an email and password, and tried every one they could think of, so they found a ride to get the defendant here for court today.

Def's dad called and stated the def was exposed to covid and was wondering what he should do about the Preliminary Hearing scheduled for tomorrow, 04/12/22 at 8:30 AM. He was told to contact his attorney so they could decide how to proceed. Def's father was informed if he could not get in contact with the attorney by 4 PM to contact our office.  Defendant's father called to say they have called the attorney a couple of times and left messages. Ok - per Judge for defendant to appear via zoom.
Preliminary hearing on April 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:22 AM Defendant ROBERT C RICE in court.  Attorney Michael Kapelis in court for ROBERT C RICE. Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and requests preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. ADA McElroy makes bond recommendation. Atty Kapelis makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant does not waive the time limits. Court will set for Preliminary Hearing April 12, 2022 at 8:30 Am.

Court adjourned at 9:24 AM.
